subject: Sexual Health
title: IVF Explained
description: A micro-lesson that makes IVF Explained usable.

hook.text: In vitro fertilization creates embryos in a lab, bypassing many of the barriers to natural conception.

buildup.text: Hormone injections stimulate the ovaries to produce multiple eggs, which are then retrieved surgically.

discovery.text: Eggs are combined with sperm in a dish. Fertilized embryos grow for 3 to 5 days before transfer.

twist.text: IVF success rates vary greatly. Age is the biggest factor, ranging from 50% at 30 to under 10% at 42.

climax.text: Since 1978, over 12 million babies have been born through IVF, making it one of medicine's great advances.

punchline.text: 12 million babies born from science and hope.

quiz.question: How many babies have been born through IVF worldwide?
